title: Sri Lanka A clinch semi-final spot after thrilling 6-run win over Bangladesh A in Doha
byline: Sri Lanka A sealed their spot in the semi-finals of the Asia Cup Rising Stars 2025 with a tense 6-run victory over Bangladesh A in Doha, confirming a final four lineup featuring Pakistan, India, Sri Lanka and Bangladesh.

title: FIFA World Cup 2026: Who’s In, Who’s Out, and Who Can Still Make It?
byline:
Who Has Already Qualified?
With the latest round of matches, 42 of the 48 spots are now filled. Here’s the full breakdown by region:

title: ’Tremendous honour’ - Federer added to Hall of Fame
byline: Roger Federer will become the first member of the ’Big Three’ of tennis to be inducted into the International Tennis Hall of Fame.

title: Hakimi and Chebbak named African players of the year
byline: Morocco right-back Achraf Hakimi has been crowned the 2025 African Footballer of the Year at the Confederation of African Football (Caf) Awards in Rabat on a successful night for the host nation.

title: Sri Lanka Clash with Zimbabwe as Shanaka Takes Charge
byline: The second match of the Pakistan T20I Tri-Series 2025 will see Sri Lanka take on Zimbabwe on Today, at the Rawalpindi Cricket Stadium.

title: 'Tremendous honour' - Federer added to Hall of Fame
byline: Roger Federer will become the first member of the ’Big Three’ of tennis to be inducted into the International Tennis Hall of Fame.

title: Three nabbed at BIA with Rs. 40 million worth of ’Kush’
byline: Three passengers were arrested at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) last night (19) after attempting to carry out of the airport a stock of ’Kush’ drugs valued at Rs. 40 million.

title: Sapugaskanda refinery to be developed on build, operate and transfer basis: Minister
byline: The Sapugaskanda refinery development project, which will be on a build, operate and transfer basis (BOT), will begin soon, Minister of Power and Energy Kumara Jayakody told Parliament today.

title: Police to get DIG in charge of cyber crimes: Minister
byline: The Sri Lanka Police will soon get a DIG in charge of cyber crimes, while a special division will also be established, Minister of Public Security Ananda Wijepala told Parliament today.

title: Upcountry train services remain limited due to landslide
byline: Train services on the upcountry line remain limited today following a landslide between Ohiya and Idalgashinna, affecting routes from Colombo to Nanu Oya and from Badulla to Bandrawela, the Railways Department confirmed.

title: SL’s healthcare system can save roughly Rs. 3.32 trillion with Tobacco reduction strategies
byline: Sri Lanka’s healthcare system has the opportunity save up to GBP 8.2 billion in around 30 years, through comprehensive Tobacco Harm Reduction (THR), a medical expert on tobacco regulation declared recently.

title: Nearly quarter million vacancies to continue in state sector in 2026
byline: Nearly a quarter of a million vacancies are set to remain unfilled across Sri Lanka’s public sector as the government moves to limit new recruitments to the bare minimum for the upcoming fiscal year (2026).

title: Sri Lanka targets 4 million tourists, US$8 billion revenue by 2030: Minister
byline: Sri Lanka aims to attract four million tourists and generate US$ 8 billion in revenue by 2030, Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism Minister Vijitha Herath announced during the India–Sri Lanka Tourism Relations programme in Colombo, yesterday (19).

title: Sri Lanka seeks Indian investors, filmmakers to boost tourism
byline: Sri Lanka is inviting Indian investors and film producers to explore new tourism ventures and film projects in the country, Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism Minister Vijitha Herath said yesterday (19).

title: IRD records highest tax revenue in its history
byline: The Inland Revenue Department (IRD) has announced that it has achieved the highest tax revenue collection in its history, reaching Rs. 2,002,241 million as of November 17.

title: SEC warns rogue market influencers
byline: The capital market regulator, the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), yesterday sounded its sternest warning yet, as a new breed of self-styled “market gurus” tighten their grip on social media.

title: Sri Lanka hits 17,000 annual IT graduate target as industry turns focus to AI upskilling
byline: Sri Lanka has successfully bridged its long-standing gap in IT graduate numbers, with the annual supply now reaching approximately 17,000, according to top industry official Shehani Seneviratne.

title: Yatiyanthota Pradeshiya Sabha 2026 budget defeated
byline: The 2026 budget of the Yatiyanthota Pradeshiya Sabha, led by the National People’s Power (NPP), was defeated today by a margin of four votes.

title: Health authorities warn of rising misuse of antibiotics
byline: Health authorities have raised alarm over the widespread and indiscriminate use of antibiotics, cautioning that such practices are accelerating antimicrobial resistance (AMR) and could render common treatments for infections increasingly ineffective.

title: 27 Indian fishermen repatriated from Sri Lanka
byline: A group of 27 Indian fishermen were repatriated to India today, the Indian High Commission in Sri Lanka said.

title: Smoking among schoolchildren on the rise: Expert
byline: Smoking among schoolchildren is on the increase, according to Consultant Respiratory Physician Dr. Duminda Yasaratne.

title: No decision to change nurses’ uniform: Heath Minister
byline: The government has not taken any decision to change the uniform of the nursing officers, Health Minister Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa said today.

title: Pressure mounts on Govt. as Easter Sunday probe lacks results
byline: The recent remarks made by President Anura Kumara Dissanayake in Parliament have cast doubt on the integrity of the investigations into the 2019 Easter Sunday attacks after he revealed that critical evidence had gone missing, potentially hindering the ongoing probe.

title: Hakimi and Chebbak named African players of the year
byline: Morocco right-back Achraf Hakimi has been crowned the 2025 African Footballer of the Year at the Confederation of African Football (Caf) Awards in Rabat on a successful night for the host nation.

title: 'Tremendous honour' - Federer added to Hall of Fame
byline: Roger Federer will become the first member of the ’Big Three’ of tennis to be inducted into the International Tennis Hall of Fame.

title: Land Bank to be set up for industrial development, Minister
byline: A land bank will soon be set up to acquire land suitable for industrial development, Industry and Entrepreneurship Development Minister Sunil Handunnethi said.

title: Nigerian hacks Senior DIG’s WhatsApp, Rs. 400,000 defrauded
byline: The Colombo Cyber Crimes Division informed the Colombo Chief Magistrate that investigations have been conducted into a Nigerian national suspected of hacking the WhatsApp account of a senior police officer and defrauding Rs. 400,000.

title: No three-wheeler licenses for foreigners in Sri Lanka: DMT clarifies
byline: The Department of Motor Traffic (DMT) has clarified that it does not issue driving licenses to foreigners for operating three-wheelers in the country.

title: Nalinda possessed by Ranil?: Ajith P. Perera
byline: It appears that Chief Government Whip Nalinda Jayatissa has been influenced by former President Ranil Wickremesinghe, Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) MP Ajith P. Perera told Parliament today.

title: Meta alerts young Australians to download their data before a social media ban
byline: Technology giant Meta on Thursday began sending thousands of young Australians a two-week warning to downland their digital histories and delete their accounts from Facebook, Instagram and Threads before a world-first social media ban on accounts of children younger than 16 takes effect.

title: Severe Triphosha shortage reported in maternity and children’s hospitals
byline: A severe shortage of Triphosha has been reported in many maternity and children’s hospitals across the country, Federation of Medical and Civil Rights Doctors’ Trade Unions Chairman Dr. Chamal Sanjeewa said.

title: Helmsman who was on his phone when South Korea ferry ran aground, arrested
byline: Arrests have been made after a ferry ran aground on rocks off South Korea’s south-east coast, according to media reports.

title: Special traffic plan for Opposition rally in Nugegoda
byline: A special traffic plan has been implemented for the opposition rally scheduled at the Ananda Samarakoon Open Air Theatre in Nugegoda tomorrow.

title: Sajith wants MPs protected from snakes in Parliament
byline: Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa today urged Speaker Jagath Wickremerathna to ensure that Members of Parliament are protected from snakes that enter Parliament.

title: UNICEF’s “Little Amaya – See Me, Hear Me” exhibit opens at Lotus Tower
byline: Sri Lanka marked World Children’s Day and the anniversary of the Convention on the Rights of the Child with the official opening of Little Amaya – See Me, Hear Me, an immersive, interactive child-rights experience and art exhibition at the Lotus Tower.

title: NPP’s Tangalle UC budget defeated
byline: The inaugural budget of the Tangalle Urban Council, which is under the control of the National People’s Power (NPP), has been defeated.

title: Order for LECO Chairman’s vehicle cancelled: Minister
byline: The order placed for a vehicle for the Lanka Electricity Company (LECO) Chairman has been cancelled and an inquiry has been launched into the order of the vehicle, Power and Energy Minister Kumara Jayakody said today.

title: Complaint lodged with Bribery Commission over 18 CPSTL TU members: Minister
byline: A complaint was lodged with the Bribery Commission over an illegal payment of Rs. 1,067,000 to 18 trade union members of the Ceylon Petroleum Storage Terminals Ltd., (CPSTL) as salaries and overtime payments, Power and Energy Minister Kumara Jayakody said today.

title: Sri Lanka among top 50 travel destinations for 2026
byline: Sri Lanka has been named one of the “50 Best Places to Travel in 2026” by the magazine Travel + Leisure.

title: SL-India power grid will be connected through a high voltage line: Minister
byline: The Sri Lankan and Indian power grid will be connected through a high voltage line, Minister of Power and Energy Kumara Jayakody told Parliament today.

title: Another Sri Lankan dies in Israel
byline: A Sri Lankan employed in the construction sector in Israel has died after being hospitalised due to a heart condition.

title: Parcel from Thailand leads to Rs. 300mn drug bust
byline: A suspicious parcel sent from Thailand on November 10 has resulted in a major narcotics seizure after officials at the Central Mail Exchange Office intercepted it on suspicion of containing illicit substances.

title: ASPI rebounds as market finds support
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange saw a mild recovery on Thursday (20th November 2025), as the market took a breather following a nearly 3% pullback from its all time high. The ASPI gained 75.10 points (+0.33%) to close at 23,104.96, while the S&P SL20 advanced 20.60 points (+0.32%) to 6,382.18. Volatility remained subdued throughout the session, though activity levels stayed muted with market turnover posting a modest LKR 3.49 Bn.

title: DMT suspends issuance of three-wheeler licences to foreigners
byline: The Department of Motor Traffic (DMT) announced that it has temporarily halted the issuance of driving licences for foreign nationals seeking to operate three-wheelers in Sri Lanka.

title: Sri Lanka and India hold bilateral discussions
byline: Sri Lanka and India held a bilateral discussion on the sidelines of the 7th National Security Advisers-level Meeting of the Colombo Security Conclave (CSC), held in New Delhi19th20th November (2025).

title: President vows no political protection for criminals or drug traffickers
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake said today that his government will not protect any criminal or drug trafficker and is fully committed to protecting children and the country from the growing drug problem.

title: A-380 makes emergency landing at BIA after passenger falls ill
byline: An A380, one of the world’s largest passenger aircraft, made an emergency landing at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) this evening after a passenger suddenly fell ill, an airport duty officer confirmed.
